_header: O glorious queen of all flowers flower
_description: ‘A miracle of oure lady done to ser Amery knyght’ — one stanza rhyme royal and twenty couplets

TCD432.First Lines:
O glorious quene of all floures floureWith her loving replet with
                    all goodenes…
TCD432.Last Lines:
…& by myracle of our lady restoried agayneOf moche more
                    tresoure þan euer þei sayne
TCD432.Attributed Title:
A miracle of oure lady done to ser Amery Knyght (f.
                    63v)
TCD432.Editions:
Brotanek,  Rudolph. 
             Mittelenglische Dichtungen aus der Handschrift 432 des Trinity College
                in Dublin.
         Halle: Niemeyer, 1940: 67-8.

                        ed.
